instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Stuck on Apple logo - Progress Bar
threads.message:
Hello guys!

I have a MacBook that had water damage. It had missing 20v which I fixed by replacing the type C chips and charging port. It had <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, but no CPU core. Fixed it by replacing bad <RESISTOR>R7101</RESISTOR> / <CAPACITOR>C7101</CAPACITOR> and ran a wire to <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> <SIGNAL>CPUVR_VIN</SIGNAL>. Now it boots, however it would never get past the  Apple logo with progress bar. I notice that I never get GPU core at any point during the OS loading.

I was able to boot to linux with basic display drivers and so I imaged the SSD to back it up via dd command, but it seems like if I try to boot into the macOS, or installer it will just freeze up at a certain point. When I ran Apple diagnostics I would get the error VFD001 - "There may be an issue with the display."

What can be the issue? Could <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> be partially bad? GPU MOSFETs? Anything else to check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Stuck on Apple logo - Progress Bar
threads.message:
Disconnect internal LCD and test  with external monitor.
Do not expect iGPU core voltage on boot; it appears only when high graphics load is detected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Stuck on Apple logo - Progress Bar
threads.message: I disconnected the LCD and tested with external monitor with known good working type C to HDMI adaptor and it did not output anything. I also tested with LCD connected - same result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Stuck on Apple logo - Progress Bar
threads.message:
USB mouse works?
Test it accessing boot menu.
If doesn't work, may need to change USB redriver; the chip which doesn't appear on schematic, nor boardview.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Stuck on Apple logo - Progress Bar
threads.message:
USB mouse works fine when I boot to linux with user interface.

I replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> to rule it out since <RESISTOR>R7101</RESISTOR> was blown right beside it.

I tried booting macOS with verbose text. These images are on two separate startup attempts. Output is a little different on each attempt, but maybe there is a pattern?

[URL unfurl="true"]https://ibb.co/jMdm4Tc[/URL]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://ibb.co/J2gHsFN[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Stuck on Apple logo - Progress Bar
threads.message:
Very likely bad CPU.

Remove internal SSD and try booting USB macOS.
